alert.note: Alert for Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 01 at 4:17PM EDT until September 03 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina...South Carolina... Lumber River Near Lumberton affecting Robeson County. Waccamaw River At Conway affecting Horry County. Black Creek At Quinby affecting Darlington and Florence Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina...South Carolina... Northeast Cape Fear River Near Burgaw affecting Pender County. Lumber River 1 SE Nichols affecting Dillon, Marion and Horry Counties. Little Pee Dee River At Galivants Ferry affecting Marion and Horry Counties. Black River At Kingstree affecting Williamsburg County. For the Northeast Cape Fear River...including Burgaw...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lumber River...including Nichols, Pembroke, Lumberton Usgs Gage, Maxton, Lumberton, Boardman...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Little Pee Dee River...including Galivants Ferry...Major flooding is forecast. For the Waccamaw River...including Aiw At old Hwy 544 At Socastee, Conway, Above Conway, Freeland, Longs...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black Creek...including Black Creek Nr Hartsville, Quinby... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black River...including Kingstree...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Waccamaw River at Conway. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water will begin to cause minor flooding of yards and a few roads in the Lees Landing, Pitch Landing, Savannah Bluff, and Riverfront South communities. Areas along Waccamaw CIR, Gray Oaks DR, and Riverside DR may also begin to flood. Access to Hidden River RD may be cutoff. Overflow of vast uninhabited swamp and natural boat landings will occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EDT Friday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by Saturday morning.
